result.execSummary:
The defendant Kent Kleven was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kent Kleven is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kent Kleven was found guilty of Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Kent  Kleven in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct,.1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee is not requesting a PSI.  Atty Gumz states that the defense is not requesting a PSI.  Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Impose and Stay; 3 years 6 months in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 2 years Initial Confinement and 1 year 6 months Extended Supervision with conditions:
*36 months Probation with conditions
*Court Costs = $268.00
*DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
*Comply with any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
*Compliance with Sex Offender Registry requirements
Credit = 5 days (if revoked)
Cash bond will be applied
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

No PSI will be ordered.
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 22, 2017 at 09:45 am.

Transcript Motion Hearing 9-6-16
Reporter Jill Bartol
Jury trial on June 15, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on May 5, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Final pre-trial on March 3, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on April 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kent  Kleven in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Kent  Kleven in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.
  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for April 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 3, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kent  Kleven in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the parties will be asking for a reset today as there is discussion regarding resolution.  Court questions the motion.  Atty Gumz agrees and states that Judge Wright did make a ruling on the motion.

BY THE COURT:  Reset Prelim.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kent  Kleven in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; he was unsure if his client was going to be here today so the State had called off the officer.  Atty Hendee asks that the matter be reset along with the motion.  Atty Gumz agrees and had been contacted by his client and was told that he was not going to be here today.  Atty Gumz asks for a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on October 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kent  Kleven in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that Atty Gumz has filed a motion to dismiss on the matter.  Atty Hendee filed an amended criminal complaint this morning addressing the concerns that Atty Gumz had for the factual basis of the complaint.  Atty Gumz did receive a copy of the amended criminal complaint; the concerns in the original motion still applies to the amended complaint as well.
Atty Gumz argues his motion with the court.  Atty Hendee responds.
BY THE COURT:  Court denies the defendant's motion.

Atty Hendee asks that the Prelim be reset.  Atty Gumz agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Reset Prelim.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Motion to Dismiss Complaint
Atty Mark Gumz
Preliminary hearing on September 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.
*No special conditions

Defendant Kent Kleven in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Kent Kleven in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz states that there is insufficient probable cause in the complaint and will move to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

Court questions the defendant regarding the time limits.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; set for Prelim.

Defendant Kent Kleven in court with attorney .  Defendant Kent Kleven in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond.
Atty Gumz responds and asks the court to release the defendant without bail and states reasons.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.
